docs.description: the output cifti file

USE LOTS OF MEMORY TO RESAMPLE DCONN.

This command does the same thing as running -cifti-resample twice, but uses memory up to approximately 2x the size that the intermediate file would be.  This is because the intermediate dconn is kept in memory, rather than written to disk, and the components before and after resampling/dilation have to be in memory at the same time during the relevant computation.  The <template-direction> argument should usually be COLUMN, as dtseries, dscalar, and dlabel all have brainordinates on that direction.  If spheres are not specified for a surface structure which exists in the cifti files, its data is copied without resampling or dilation.  Dilation is done with the 'nearest' method, and is done on <new-sphere> for surface data.  Volume components are padded before dilation so that dilation doesn't run into the edge of the component bounding box.

To get the v1.3.2 and earlier behavior of weighted dilation, specify exponent of 2 for surface and volume, and -legacy-cutoff for both surface and volume.

The <volume-method> argument must be one of the following:

CUBIC
ENCLOSING_VOXEL
TRILINEAR

The <surface-method> argument must be one of the following:

ADAP_BARY_AREA
BARYCENTRIC
the output cifti file
use largest weight instead of weighted average when doing surface resampling
dilate the volume components before resampling
distance, in mm, to dilate
use nearest value dilation
use weighted dilation (default)

specify exponent in weighting function

exponent 'n' to use in (1 / (distance ^ n)) as the weighting function (default 7)
use v1.3.2 logic for the kernel cutoff
use weighted dilation (default)
dilate the volume components before resampling
dilate the surface components after resampling
distance, in mm, to dilate
use nearest value dilation
use linear dilation
use weighted dilation (default)

specify exponent in weighting function

exponent 'n' to use in (area / (distance ^ n)) as the weighting function (default 6)
use v1.3.2 logic for the kernel cutoff
use weighted dilation (default)
dilate the surface components after resampling
use an affine transformation on the volume components
the affine file to use
MUST be used if affine is a flirt affine
the source volume used when generating the affine
the target volume used when generating the affine
MUST be used if affine is a flirt affine
use an affine transformation on the volume components
use a warpfield on the volume components
the warpfield to use

MUST be used if using a fnirt warpfield

the source volume used when generating the warpfield
use a warpfield on the volume components
specify spheres for left surface resampling
a sphere with the same mesh as the current left surface
a sphere with the new left mesh that is in register with the current sphere
specify left surfaces to do vertex area correction based on
a relevant left anatomical surface with current mesh
a relevant left anatomical surface with new mesh
specify left surfaces to do vertex area correction based on
specify left vertex area metrics to do area correction based on
a metric file with vertex areas for the current mesh
a metric file with vertex areas for the new mesh
specify left vertex area metrics to do area correction based on
specify spheres for left surface resampling
specify spheres for right surface resampling
a sphere with the same mesh as the current right surface
a sphere with the new right mesh that is in register with the current sphere
specify right surfaces to do vertex area correction based on
a relevant right anatomical surface with current mesh
a relevant right anatomical surface with new mesh
specify right surfaces to do vertex area correction based on
specify right vertex area metrics to do area correction based on
a metric file with vertex areas for the current mesh
a metric file with vertex areas for the new mesh
specify right vertex area metrics to do area correction based on
specify spheres for right surface resampling
specify spheres for cerebellum surface resampling
a sphere with the same mesh as the current cerebellum surface
a sphere with the new cerebellum mesh that is in register with the current sphere
specify cerebellum surfaces to do vertex area correction based on

the cifti file to resample

the direction of the template to use as the resampling space, ROW or COLUMN
specify a surface resampling method
specify a volume interpolation method

USE LOTS OF MEMORY TO RESAMPLE DCONN.
